summary.span: 提供文化特性特定的格式和剖析數值資訊。

span.span: Provides culture-specific information for formatting and parsing numeric values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 類別包含您格式化和剖析數值時，會使用的特定文化特性資訊。The class contains culture-specific information that is used when you format and parse numeric values. 這項資訊包括貨幣符號，小數點符號、 群組分隔符號，正負號的符號。This information includes the currency symbol, the decimal symbol, the group separator symbol, and the symbols for positive and negative signs. - [NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object](#Instantiating) - [目前的文化特性For the current culture](#Instantiating_Current) - [而異的文化特性For the invariant culture](#Instantiating_Invariant) - [特定文化特性For a specific culture](#Instantiating_Specific) - [中性文化特性For a neutral culture](#Instantiating_Neutral) - [NumberFormatInfo 和動態資料NumberFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) - [IFormatProvider、 NumberFormatInfo，和數字格式化IFormatProvider, NumberFormatInfo, and numeric formatting](#formatProvider) - [格式字串和 NumberFormatInfo 屬性Format strings and NumberFormatInfo properties](#properties) - [修改 NumberFormatInfo 屬性Modifying NumberFormatInfo properties](#modifying) - [修改的貨幣符號和模式Modifying the currency symbol and pattern](#currency) - [格式化身分證號碼Formatting a national identification number](#id) - [剖析數值字串Parsing numeric strings](#parsing) - [剖析使用者字串Parsing user strings](#ParseUser) - [序列化和還原序列化的數值資料Serializing and deserializing numeric data](#ParseSerial) ## NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object 您可以具現化物件，表示目前的文化特性、 文化特性而異，特定的文化特性或中性文化特性的格式化慣例。You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture, the invariant culture, a specific culture, or a neutral culture. ## 目前的文化特性的 NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object for the current culture 您可以具現化目前執行緒文化特性，在下列任一方式的物件。You can instantiate a object for the current thread culture in any of the following ways. 在每個案例中，傳回物件是唯讀的。In each case, the returned object is read-only. - 藉由擷取物件，表示目前執行緒文化特性，從屬性，並擷取物件從其屬性。By retrieving a object that represents the current thread culture from the property, and retrieving the object from its property. - 藉由擷取所傳回的物件`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)屬性。By retrieving the object returned by the `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) property. - 藉由呼叫方法使用物件，表示目前的文化特性。By calling the method with a object that represents the current culture. 下列範例會使用下列三種方式來建立物件，代表目前的文化特性的格式化慣例。The following example uses these three ways to create objects that represent the formatting conventions of the current culture. 它也會擷取的值來說明每個物件是唯讀的屬性。It also retrieves the value of the property to illustrate that each object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#1)] 您可以建立可寫入物件，表示目前執行緒文化特性的慣例，在下列任一方式：You can create a writable object that represents the conventions of the current thread culture in any of the following ways: - 藉由擷取物件的方式說明在先前的程式碼範例中，並呼叫任一方法在傳回物件。By retrieving a object in any of the ways illustrated in the previous code example, and calling the method on the returned object. 這會建立一份原始物件，不同之處在於其屬性是`false`。This creates a copy of the original object, except that its property is `false`. - 藉由呼叫方法用來建立物件，代表目前的文化特性，並接著使用及其屬性，以擷取物件。By calling the method to create a object that represents the current culture, and then using its property to retrieve the object. 下列範例說明這兩種方式，具現化物件，並顯示的值及其來說明物件不是唯讀的屬性。The following example illustrates these two ways of instantiating a object, and displays the value of its property to illustrate that the object is not read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate2.vb#2)] 請注意，Windows 作業系統允許使用者覆寫的一些屬性值中數值的格式化和剖析作業透過使用**地區和語言**控制台 中的項目。Note that the Windows operating system allows the user to override some of the property values used in numeric formatting and parsing operations through the **Region and Language** item in Control Panel. 比方說，的使用者文化特性是英文 （美國） 可能會選擇要顯示為 1.1 美元的貨幣值，而不是預設值為 $1.1。For example, a user whose culture is English (United States) might choose to display currency values as 1.1 USD instead of the default of $1.1. 物件中所討論的方式擷取先前所有反映這些使用者覆寫。The objects retrieved in the ways discussed previously all reflect these user overrides. 如果這不需要，您可以建立不會反映使用者覆寫的物件 (同時為讀取/寫入，而非唯讀狀態) 藉由呼叫建構函式，並提供值為`false`如`useUserOverride`引數。If this is undesirable, you can create a object that does not reflect user overrides (and that is also read/write rather than read-only) by calling the constructor and supplying a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 下列範例說明系統目前文化特性是英文 （美國） 和其貨幣符號已從預設的 $ 變更美元。The following example provides an illustration for a system whose current culture is English (United States) and whose currency symbol has been changed from the default of $ to USD. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate3.vb#3)] 如果屬性設定為`true`，屬性， ，和也都擷取自使用者設定。If the property is set to `true`, the properties , , and are also retrieved from the user settings. 如果使用者設定都與相關聯的文化特性不相容物件 (例如，如果所選行事曆不是其中一個列出的行事曆屬性)，結果的方法和屬性的值未定義。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the object (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the calendars listed by the property), the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. ## 具現化的文化特性而異的 NumberFormatInfo 物件Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object for the invariant culture 文化特性而異表示不區分文化特性的文化特性。The invariant culture represents a culture that is culture-insensitive. 它採用有關英文的語言，但不是能在任何特定英文國家/地區。It is based on the English language but not on any specific English-speaking country/region. 雖然特定文化特性的資料可以是動態的而且能夠變更以反映新的文化特性慣例或使用者的喜好設定，而異的文化特性的資料不會變更。Although the data of specific cultures can be dynamic and can change to reflect new cultural conventions or user preferences, the data of the invariant culture does not change. A物件，表示不區分文化特性的格式化慣例可供進行格式化的作業的結果字串應該因文化特性。A object that represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture can be used for formatting operations in which result strings should not vary by culture. 您可以具現化物件，表示不區分文化特性的格式化慣例如下：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture in the following ways: - 所擷取的值屬性。By retrieving the value of the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 所擷取的值屬性從所傳回的物件屬性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由呼叫無參數類別建構函式。By calling the parameterless class constructor. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. 下列範例所使用的是每一種方法來具現化物件，表示文化特性而異。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the invariant culture. 則表示物件是唯讀的It then indicates whether the object is read-only, [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate4.vb#4)] ## 特定文化特性的 NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object for a specific culture 特定文化特性代表特定國家/地區中使用的語言。A specific culture represents a language that is spoken in a particular country/region. 例如，EN-US 代表美國境內的英文語言的特定文化特性而 en CA，代表加拿大英文語言特定文化特性。For example, en-US is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in the United States, and en-CA is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in Canada. 您可以具現化物件，代表特定文化特性的格式化慣例如下：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回物件是唯讀的。The returned object is read-only. - 藉由傳遞代表的文化特性的物件其物件您想要擷取靜態方法。By passing a object that represents the culture whose object you want to retrieve to the static method. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 藉由呼叫方法，並擷取傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling the method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. - 透過呼叫其中一個類別建構函式和擷取所傳回的值物件的屬性。By calling one of the class constructors and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 傳回的 物件是讀取/寫入。The returned object is read/write. 下列範例會使用下列四種方式來建立反映出印尼文 （印尼） 文化特性的格式化慣例的物件。The following example uses these four ways to create a object that reflects the formatting conventions of the Indonesian (Indonesia) culture. 它也會指出每個物件是否為唯讀。It also indicates whether each object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate5.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate5.vb#5)] ## 中性文化特性的 NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object for a neutral culture 中性文化特性表示文化特性或語言無關的國家/地區。A neutral culture represents a culture or language that is independent of a country/region. 它通常是一或多個特定的文化特性的父代。It is typically the parent of one or more specific cultures. 比方說，fr 是法文的語言和父代為 FR-FR 文化特性的中性文化特性。For example, fr is a neutral culture for the French language and the parent of the fr-FR culture. 您建立物件，代表中性文化特性的格式化慣例，在您建立的相同方式物件，代表特定文化特性的格式化慣例。You create a object that represents the formatting conventions of a neutral culture in the same way that you create a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture. > [!NOTE] > 在 [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和更早版本，嘗試擷取物件會反映中性文化特性的格式化慣例，會擲回例外狀況。In the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions, trying to retrieve a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a neutral culture throws a exception. 不過，因為它是獨立於特定國家/地區，中性文化特性缺少特定文化特性格式資訊。However, because it is independent of a specific country/region, a neutral culture lacks culture-specific formatting information. 而不是填入物件使用泛型值，.NET Framework 會傳回反映的格式化慣例的特定文化特性的物件是中性文化特性的子系。Rather than populating the object with generic values, the .NET Framework returns a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a specific culture that is a child of the neutral culture. 例如，物件的中性 en-us 文化特性會反映 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例，物件為 fr 文化特性反映 FR-FR 文化特性的格式化慣例。For example, the object for the neutral en culture reflects the formatting conventions of the en-US culture, and the object for the fr culture reflects the formatting conventions of the fr-FR culture. 您可以使用如下的程式碼，以判斷哪一個特定文化特性的格式化慣例，每個中性文化特性所表示。You can use code like the following to determine which specific culture's formatting conventions each neutral culture represents. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/cs/instantiate6c.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class.Instantiate#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate6c.vb#6)] ## NumberFormatInfo 和動態資料NumberFormatInfo and dynamic data 格式化數值所提供的特定文化特性的資料類別是動態的如同所提供的文化特性資料類別。The culture-specific data for formatting numeric values provided by the class is dynamic, just like the cultural data provided by the class. 您不應建立穩定性值的任何假設相關聯的物件與特定物件。You should not make any assumptions about the stability of values for objects that are associated with particular objects. 只提供區分文化特性和其相關聯的資料物件很穩定。Only the data provided by the invariant culture and its associated object is stable. 其他資料可以變更之間的應用程式工作階段，或甚至放在單一工作階段，原因如下：Other data can change between application sessions, or even within a single session, for the following reasons: - **系統更新。****System updates.** 例如，貨幣符號或貨幣格式的文化特性喜好設定會隨著時間改變。Cultural preferences such as the currency symbol or currency formats change over time. Windows Update 時若發生這種情況，包括變更特定文化特性的屬性值。When this happens, Windows Update includes changes to the property value for a particular culture. - **取代的文化特性。****Replacement cultures.** 類別可以用來取代現有的文化特性的資料。The class can be used to replace the data of an existing culture. - **階層式屬性值的變更。****Cascading changes to property values.** 一些文化特性相關的屬性可以變更在執行階段，這又會導致若要變更的資料。A number of culture-related properties can change at run time, which, in turn, causes data to change. 例如，以程式設計方式或透過使用者的動作，可以變更目前的文化特性。For example, the current culture can be changed either programmatically or through user action. 當發生這種情況所傳回的物件屬性變更為目前的文化特性相關聯的物件。When this happens, the object returned by the property changes to an object associated with the current culture. - **使用者喜好設定。****User preferences.** 應用程式的使用者可能會覆寫一些透過控制台地區及語言選項的目前系統文化特性相關聯的值。Users of your application might override some of the values associated with the current system culture through the region and language options in Control Panel. 例如，使用者可能會選擇不同的貨幣符號或不同的小數分隔符號。For example, users might choose a different currency symbol or a different decimal separator symbol. 如果屬性設定為`true`（其預設值），屬性物件也都擷取自使用者設定。If the property is set to `true` (its default value), the properties of the object are also retrieved from the user settings. 從.NET Framework 2.0 的所有使用者可覆寫屬性建立物件時，會初始化物件。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, all user-overridable properties of a object are initialized when the object is created. 仍有可能不一致，因為兩者皆非物件建立或使用者覆寫程序不可部分完成，而且相關的值可能會變更物件建立期間。There is still a possibility of inconsistency, because neither object creation nor the user override process is atomic, and the relevant values may change during object creation. 不過，這些不一致的情況應該很少發生。However, these inconsistencies should be extremely rare. 您可以控制使用者覆寫是否會反映在代表文化特性與目前執行緒文化特性相同的物件。You can control whether user overrides are reflected in objects that represent the same culture as the current thread culture. 下表列出的方式物件可以擷取，並指出是否產生的物件會反映使用者覆寫。The following table lists the ways in which a object can be retrieved and indicates whether the resulting object reflects user overrides. |NumberFormatInfo CultureInfo 物件的來源Source of CultureInfo and NumberFormatInfo object|會反映使用者覆寫Reflects user overrides| |-------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------| |`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.NumberFormat` 屬性`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.NumberFormat` property|[是]Yes| | 屬性 property|[是]Yes| | 方法 method|[是]Yes| | 方法 method|否No| | 建構函式 constructor|[是]Yes| | 建構函式 constructor|取決於值`useUserOverride`參數Depends on value of `useUserOverride` parameter| 除非有充分的理由，否則您就應該採用使用者覆寫，當您使用格式化和剖析使用者輸入或顯示數值資料的用戶端應用程式中的物件。Unless there is a compelling reason to do otherwise, you should respect user overrides when you use the object in client applications to format and parse user input or to display numeric data. 針對伺服器應用程式或自動執行應用程式，您不應該遵守使用者覆寫。For server applications or unattended applications, you should not respect user overrides. 不過，如果您使用物件是明確或隱含方式來保存字串形式的數值資料，您應該使用反映格式設定慣例的文化特性而異，或您的物件應該指定您使用不論文化特性的自訂數值格式字串。However, if you are using the object either explicitly or implicitly to persist numeric data in string form, you should either use a object that reflects the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, or you should specify a custom numeric format string that you use regardless of culture. ## IFormatProvider、 NumberFormatInfo，和數字格式化IFormatProvider, NumberFormatInfo, and numeric formatting A物件會隱含或明確地在格式化作業中的所有數字。A object is used implicitly or explicitly in all numeric formatting operations. 這些包括呼叫下列方法：These include calls to the following methods: - 所有的數值格式化方法，例如， ，和。All numeric formatting methods, such as , , and . - 主要的複合格式化方法， 。The major composite formatting method, . - 其他複合格式化方法，例如和。Other composite formatting methods, such as and . 所有數字的格式設定作業進行使用實作。All numeric formatting operations make use of an implementation. 介面會包含單一方法。The interface includes a single method, . 這是傳遞一個回呼方法物件，表示提供格式設定資訊所需的型別。This is a callback method that is passed a object that represents the type needed to provide formatting information. 方法負責傳回該類型的執行個體或`null`，如果它無法提供類型的執行個體。The method is responsible for returning either an instance of that type or `null`, if it cannot provide an instance of the type. .NET Framework 會提供兩個格式化數字的實作：The .NET Framework provides two implementations for formatting numbers: - 類別，其代表特定文化特性 （或特定國家/地區中的特定語言）。The class, which represents a specific culture (or a specific language in a specific country/region). 在格式化作業中，數字方法會傳回相關聯的物件及其屬性。In a numeric formatting operation, the method returns the object associated with its property. - 類別，可提供其相關聯的文化特性的格式化慣例相關資訊。The class, which provides information about the formatting conventions of its associated culture. 方法會傳回本身的執行個體。The method returns an instance of itself. 如果實作未提供格式化方法來明確地所傳回的物件使用代表目前執行緒文化特性的屬性。If an implementation is not provided to a formatting method explicitly, a object returned by the property that represents the current thread culture is used. 下列範例說明之間的關聯性介面和在格式化作業中透過定義自訂類別實作。The following example illustrates the relationship between the interface and the class in formatting operations by defining a custom implementation. 其方法會顯示格式化作業所要求之物件的型別名稱。Its method displays the type name of the object requested by the formatting operation. 如果要求的介面物件，這個方法會提供目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If the interface is requesting a object, this method provides the object for the current thread culture. 做為範例所示，從輸出方法要求物件，提供格式設定資訊，而方法要求並物件以及實作。As the output from the example shows, the method requests a object to provide formatting information, whereas the method requests and objects as well as an implementation. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/formatprovider1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/formatprovider1.vb#1)] 如果數值格式化方法呼叫，方法呼叫中未明確提供實作`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.GetFormat`方法，以傳回對應至目前執行緒文化特性的物件。If an implementation is not explicitly provided in a numeric formatting method call, the method calls the `CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.GetFormat` method, which returns the object that corresponds to the current thread culture. ## 格式字串和 NumberFormatInfo 屬性Format strings and NumberFormatInfo properties 每個格式設定操作使用標準或自訂數值格式字串來產生的結果字串會從數字。Every formatting operation uses either a standard or a custom numeric format string to produce a result string from a number. 在某些情況下，要產生的結果字串的格式字串用法是明確的如下列範例所示。In some cases, the use of a format string to produce a result string is explicit, as in the following example. 此程式碼會呼叫方法，將轉換數個不同的字串表示法使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例的值。This code calls the method to convert a value to a number of different string representations by using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/properties1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/properties1.vb#2)] 在其他情況下，使用格式字串都是隱含的。In other cases, the use of a format string is implicit. 例如，在下列的方法呼叫為預設值或無參數方法中，值使用一般 ("G") 格式規範，並在此情況下的目前文化特性的慣例格式化執行個體EN-US 文化特性。For example, in the following method calls to the default or parameterless method, the value of the instance is formatted by using the general ("G") format specifier and the conventions of the current culture, which in this case is the en-US culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/properties2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/properties2.vb#3)] 每個標準數值格式字串會使用一或多個屬性，以決定模式或結果字串中使用的符號。Each standard numeric format string uses one or more properties to determine the pattern or the symbols used in the result string. 同樣地，每個自訂數值格式規範除了"0"、"#"的符號則會在所定義的結果字串中插入屬性。Similarly, each custom numeric format specifier except "0" and "#" insert symbols in the result string that are defined by properties. 下表列出標準和自訂數值格式規範和其相關聯屬性。The following table lists the standard and custom numeric format specifiers and their associated properties. 若要變更的特定文化特性的結果字串的外觀，請參閱[修改 NumberFormatInfo 屬性](#modifying)一節。To change the appearance of the result string for a particular culture, see the [Modifying NumberFormatInfo properties](#modifying) section. 如需使用這些詳細資料格式規範，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)並[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For details about the use of these format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). |格式規範Format specifier|相關聯的屬性Associated properties| |----------------------|---------------------------| |"C"或者"c"（貨幣格式規範）"C" or "c" (currency format specifier)|定義預設小數位數。, to define the default number of fractional digits.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

可定義負值的貨幣值的模式。, to define the pattern of negative currency values.

來定義正數貨幣值的模式。, to define the pattern of positive currency values.

定義的貨幣符號。, to define the currency symbol.

定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.| |"D"或者"d"（十進位格式規範）"D" or "d" (decimal format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.| |"E"或者"e"（指數或以科學記號格式規範）"E" or "e" (exponential or scientific format specifier)|定義中的尾數和指數的負號。, to define the negative sign symbol in the mantissa and exponent.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

以指數中定義的正號。, to define the positive sign symbol in the exponent.| |"F"或者"f"（固定點格式規範）"F" or "f" (fixed-point format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.

定義預設小數位數。, to define the default number of fractional digits.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.| |"G"或者"g"（一般格式規範）"G" or "g" (general format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

定義結果字串的正號符號指數 」 格式。, to define the positive sign symbol for result strings in exponential format.| |"N"或者"n"（數字格式規範）"N" or "n" (number format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.

定義預設小數位數。, to define the default number of fractional digits.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

定義群組分隔符號 （千為單位）。, to define the group separator (thousands) symbol.

若要在群組中定義的整數位數。, to define the number of integral digits in a group.

定義負值的格式。, to define the format of negative values.| |"P"或者"p"（百分比格式規範）"P" or "p" (percent format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.

定義預設小數位數。, to define the default number of fractional digits.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

定義群組分隔符號。, to define the group separator symbol.

若要在群組中定義的整數位數。, to define the number of integral digits in a group.

若要定義百分比符號。, to define the percent symbol.| |"R"或者"r"（來回行程格式規範）"R" or "r" (round-trip format specifier)| 定義負號。, to define the negative sign symbol.

定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.

(decimal point custom format specifier)| 定義小數分隔符號。, to define the decimal separator symbol.| |"，"（群組分隔符號的自訂格式規範）"," (group separator custom format specifier)|定義群組 （千位） 分隔符號。, to define the group (thousands) separator symbol.| |"%"（百分比預留位置的自訂格式規範）"%" (percentage placeholder custom format specifier)|若要定義百分比符號。, to define the percent symbol.| |"‰"（每千分比預留位置的自訂格式規範）"‰" (per mille placeholder custom format specifier)|定義每千分比符號。, to define the per mille symbol.| |"E"（指數標記法的自訂格式規範）"E" (exponential notation custom format specifier)|定義中的尾數和指數的負號。, to define the negative sign symbol in the mantissa and exponent.

以指數中定義的正號。, to define the positive sign symbol in the exponent.| 請注意，類別包含屬性，指定特定文化特性所使用的基底 10 個數字。Note that the class includes a property that specifies the base 10 digits used by a specific culture. 不過，如果屬性不使用在格式化作業;只有基本拉丁文數字 0 (U + 0030) 到 9 (U + 0039) 會在結果字串。However, the property is not used in formatting operations; only the Basic Latin digits 0 (U+0030) through 9 (U+0039) are used in the result string. 此外，對於並的值`NaN`， `PositiveInfinity`，並`NegativeInfinity`，結果字串只包含所定義的符號， ，和屬性分別。In addition, for and values of `NaN`, `PositiveInfinity`, and `NegativeInfinity`, the result string consists exclusively of the symbols defined by the , , and properties, respectively. ## 修改 NumberFormatInfo 屬性Modifying NumberFormatInfo properties 您可以修改的屬性數值格式化作業中產生自訂結果字串的物件。You can modify the properties of a object to customize the result string produced in a numeric formatting operation. 若要這樣做：To do this: 1. 建立的讀取/寫入複本物件您想要修改其格式設定慣例。Create a read/write copy of a object whose formatting conventions you want to modify. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [NumberFormatInfo 物件具現化](#Instantiating)一節。For more information, see the [Instantiating a NumberFormatInfo object](#Instantiating) section. 2. 修改或多個用來產生所要的結果字串的屬性。Modify the property or properties that are used to produce the desired result string. 如需有關如何格式化方法使用資訊屬性來定義結果字串，請參閱[格式字串和 NumberFormatInfo 屬性](#properties)一節。For information about how formatting methods use properties to define result strings, see the [Format strings and NumberFormatInfo properties](#properties) section. 3. 使用自訂物件做為格式化方法的呼叫中引數。Use the custom object as the argument in calls to formatting methods. > [!NOTE] > 除了每次應用程式啟動時動態修改文化特性的屬性值，您可以使用類別來定義自訂的文化特性 （文化特性具有唯一的名稱，且以補充現有的文化特性） 或取代文化特性 （一個是用來取代特定的文化特性）。Instead of dynamically modifying a culture's property values each time an application is started, you can use the class to define either a custom culture (a culture that has a unique name and that supplements existing cultures) or a replacement culture (one that is used instead of a specific culture). 下列各節提供一些範例。The following sections provide some examples. ### 修改的貨幣符號和模式Modifying the currency symbol and pattern 下列範例會修改物件，代表 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例。The following example modifies a object that that represents the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. 它會指派到的 ISO 4217 貨幣符號屬性，並定義貨幣值的模式，其中包含後面接著一個空格和數字值的貨幣符號。It assigns the ISO-4217 currency symbol to the property and defines a pattern for currency values that consists of the currency symbol followed by a space and a numeric value. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Customize#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.customize/cs/customize_currency1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Customize#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.customize/vb/customize_currency1.vb#1)] ### 格式化身分證號碼Formatting a national identification number 許多身分證號碼數字以獨佔方式所組成，因此可以輕鬆地加以格式化，修改的屬性物件。Many national identification numbers consist exclusively of digits and so can easily be formatted by modifying the properties of a object. 例如，在美國的社會安全號碼組成，如下所示排列的 9 位數： `XXX-XX-XXXX`。For example, a social security number in the United States consists of 9 digits arranged as follows: `XXX-XX-XXXX`. 下列範例會假設身分證號碼會儲存為整數值，並適當地將其格式化。The following example assumes that social security numbers are stored as integer values and formats them appropriately. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Customize#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.customize/cs/customize_ssn1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Customize#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.customize/vb/customize_ssn1.vb#2)] ## 剖析數值字串Parsing numeric strings 剖析牽涉到將數字的字串表示轉換的數字。Parsing involves converting the string representation of a number to a number. .NET Framework 中的每個數值類型包含兩個多載的剖析方法：`Parse`和`TryParse`。Each numeric type in the .NET Framework includes two overloaded parsing methods: `Parse` and `TryParse`. `Parse`方法將字串轉換為數字，並擲回例外狀況，如果轉換失敗。The `Parse` method converts a string to a number and throws an exception if the conversion fails. `TryParse`方法將字串轉換為數字，會指派數字`out`引數，並傳回值，指出轉換是否成功。The `TryParse` method converts a string to a number, assigns the number to an `out` argument, and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded. 剖析方法會以隱含或明確使用列舉值，以判斷樣式項目 （例如群組分隔符號，十進位分隔符號或貨幣符號） 可以出現在字串中，如果剖析作業才會成功。The parsing methods implicitly or explicitly use a enumeration value to determine what style elements (such as group separators, a decimal separator, or a currency symbol) can be present in a string if the parsing operation is to succeed. 如果值會是未提供方法呼叫中，預設值是值，包含和旗標，指定剖析的字串可以包含群組的符號、 小數分隔符號、 負號，而且泛空白字元，或它可以指數標記法之數字的字串表示。If a value is not provided in the method call, the default is a value that includes the and flags, which specifies that the parsed string can include group symbols, a decimal separator, a negative sign, and white-space characters, or it can be the string representation of a number in exponential notation. 剖析方法也會隱含地或明確地使用物件，定義特定符號和模式可能會發生在要剖析的字串。The parsing methods also implicitly or explicitly use a object that defines the specific symbols and patterns that can occur in the string to be parsed. 如果未提供物件，則預設為目前執行緒文化特性。If a object is not provided, the default is the for the current thread culture. 如需剖析的詳細資訊，請參閱個別的剖析方法，例如， ， ， ， ，和。For more information about parsing, see the individual parsing methods, such as , , , , , and . 下列範例說明剖析字串的區分文化特性的本質。The following example illustrates the culture-sensitive nature of parsing strings. 它會嘗試剖析字串，包括千位分隔符號使用 EN-US、 FR-FR 和而異的文化特性的慣例。It tries to parse a string that include thousands separators by using the conventions of the en-US, fr-FR, and invariant cultures. 其中包含以逗點做為群組分隔符號和期限，為小數分隔符號無法剖析為 FR-FR 文化特性中的字串，並含有 white space 做為群組分隔符號和逗號作為小數分隔符號的字串無法剖析以 EN-US 和文化特性而異。A string that includes the comma as a group separator and the period as a decimal separator fails to parse in the fr-FR culture, and a string with white space as a group separator and a comma as a decimal separator fails to parse in the en-US and invariant cultures. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/parse1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/parse1.vb#4)] 剖析通常就會發生在兩個內容中：Parsing generally occurs in two contexts: - 以作業是設計用來將使用者輸入轉換成數值。As an operation that is designed to convert user input into a numeric value. - 作業的設計，若要反覆存取一個數字的值;也就是要還原序列化之前已序列化為字串的數值。As an operation that is designed to round-trip a numeric value; that is, to deserialize a numeric value that was previously serialized as a string. 下列各節將討論這兩項作業中有更詳細。The following sections discuss these two operations in greater detail. ### 剖析使用者字串Parsing user strings 當您剖析使用者輸入的數字的字串時，您應該一律具現化反映使用者的文化特性設定的物件。When you are parsing numeric strings input by the user, you should always instantiate a object that reflects the user's cultural settings. 如需如何具現化物件，以反映使用者自訂設定，請參閱[NumberFormatInfo 和動態資料](#dynamic)一節。For information about how to instantiate a object that reflects user customizations, see the [NumberFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) section. 下列範例說明剖析作業中，以反映使用者的文化設定及未之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between a parsing operation that reflects user cultural settings and one that does not. 在此案例中，預設系統文化特性是 EN-US，但使用者已定義"，"做為小數符號和"。"做為群組分隔符號控制項台中**地區和語言**。In this case, the default system culture is en-US, but the user has defined "," as the decimal symbol and "." as the group separator in Control Panel, **Region and Language**. 一般情況下，這些符號會反轉預設 EN-US 文化特性中。Ordinarily, these symbols are reversed in the default en-US culture. 當使用者輸入字串會反映使用者設定，且所剖析的字串物件，也會反映使用者設定 （覆寫），在剖析作業會傳回正確的結果。When the user enters a string that reflects user settings, and the string is parsed by a object that also reflects user settings (overrides), the parsing operation returns a correct result. 不過，當字串會剖析物件，以反映標準 EN-US 文化特性設定，其錯誤為群組分隔符號的逗號符號，並傳回不正確的結果。However, when the string is parsed by a object that reflects standard en-US cultural settings, it mistakes the comma symbol for a group separator and returns an incorrect result. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/parseuser1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/parseuser1.vb#5)] ### 序列化和還原序列化的數值資料Serializing and deserializing numeric data 當數值資料以字串格式序列化和更新版本還原序列化，並剖析時，應該產生並使用不因文化特性而異的慣例來剖析字串。When numeric data is serialized in string format and later deserialized and parsed, the strings should be generated and parsed by using the conventions of the invariant culture. 「 格式化和剖析作業應該不會反映出特定的文化特性的慣例。The formatting and parsing operations should never reflect the conventions of a specific culture. 如果使用特定文化特性設定，可攜性的資料會嚴格限制;它可以成功還原序列化，只有在執行緒，其文化特性特有的設定是完全相同的執行緒在其序列化。If culture-specific settings are used, the portability of the data is strictly limited; it can be successfully deserialized only on a thread whose culture-specific settings are identical to those of the thread on which it was serialized. 在某些情況下，這表示，即使資料不會成功還原序列化的序列化所在的相同系統上。In some cases, this means that the data cannot even be successfully deserialized on the same system on which it was serialized. 下列範例說明當違反這個原則時，會發生什麼情況。The following example illustrates what can happen when this principle is violated. 當目前的執行緒會使用 EN-US 文化特性的文化特性設定，在陣列中的浮點值會轉換成字串。Floating-point values in an array are converted to strings when the current thread uses the culture-specific settings of the en-US culture. 資料會剖析會使用 EN-GB 文化特性的文化特性設定的執行緒。The data is then parsed by a thread that uses the culture-specific settings of the en-GB culture. 在此情況下，雖然每個剖析作業成功時，資料不支援往返作業成功，會發生資料損毀。In this case, although each parsing operation succeeds, the data does not round-trip successfully and data corruption occurs. 在其他情況下，可能會失敗的剖析作業和可能擲回例外狀況。In other cases, a parsing operation could fail and a exception could be thrown. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/cs/parsepersisted.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.class/vb/parsepersisted.vb#6)] ## Examples 下列範例示範如何擷取物件對應物件，並使用查詢的數字格式化特定文化特性的資訊擷取的物件。The following example shows how to retrieve a object for a corresponding object, and use the retrieved object to query number formatting information for the particular culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 複製為可寫入即使原始物件是唯讀的。The clone is writable even if the original object is read-only. 因此，可修改複製品的屬性，利用使用者定義的模式。Therefore, the properties of the clone can be modified with user-defined patterns. 物件的淺層複本是物件的一份只有。A shallow copy of an object is a copy of the object only. 如果物件包含其他物件的參考，則淺層複製不會建立參考物件的複本。If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy will not create copies of the referred objects. 它會改為參考原始物件。It will refer to the original objects instead. 相反地，物件的深層複本建立一份物件和一份直接或間接參考該物件的所有項目。On the other hand, a deep copy of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object. 若是物件的淺層複本是能夠以複製所有的執行個體屬性，因為傳回的物件參考的所有屬性都都`static`(`Shared` Visual Basic 中)。In the case of a object, a shallow copy is sufficient for copying all instance properties, because all properties that return object references are `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic). ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法用來建立的讀取/寫入複本物件，表示目前執行緒文化特性慣例的格式的數字。The following example uses the method to create a read/write copy of a object that represents the numeric formatting conventions of the current thread culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.IsReadOnly#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.isreadonly/cs/isreadonly1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.IsReadOnly#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.numberformatinfo.isreadonly/vb/isreadonly1.vb#1)]

summary.span: 取得或設定貨幣值內小數點左邊數字的各個群組中的位數。

span.span: Gets or sets the number of digits in each group to the left of the decimal in currency values.

value.span: 的預設值為一個只含有一個項目 (已設定為 3) 的一維陣列。

span.span: The default for is a one-dimensional array with only one element, which is set to 3.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性來定義出現的位數整數類資料群組中時，可與"C"標準格式字串。The property is used with the "C" standard format string to define the number of digits that appear in integral groups. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md). 一維陣列中的每個項目必須是從 1 到 9 的整數。Every element in the one-dimensional array must be an integer from 1 through 9. 最後一個項目可以是 0。The last element can be 0. 陣列的第一個元素的左邊的數字的最小顯著性群組中定義的項目數。The first element of the array defines the number of elements in the least significant group of digits immediately to the left of the . 每個後續項目是指先前群組的左邊的數字的下一個重要群組。Each subsequent element refers to the next significant group of digits to the left of the previous group. 如果陣列的最後一個項目不是 0，其餘的數字會根據分組陣列的最後一個元素。If the last element of the array is not 0, the remaining digits are grouped based on the last element of the array. 如果最後一個項目為 0，會不會分組其餘數字。If the last element is 0, the remaining digits are not grouped. 例如，如果陣列包含 {3，4，5}，字分組的類似於"$55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00"。For example, if the array contains { 3, 4, 5 }, the digits are grouped similar to "$55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00". 如果陣列包含 {3，4，0}，數字都會群組類似於"$55555555555555555,4444,333.00"。If the array contains { 3, 4, 0 }, the digits are grouped similar to "$55555555555555555,4444,333.00". ## Examples 下列範例示範變更的影響屬性。The following example demonstrates the effect of changing the property. [!code-cpp[CurrencyGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CurrencyGroupSizes/CPP/currencygroupsizes.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[CurrencyGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CurrencyGroupSizes/CS/currencygroupsizes.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CurrencyGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CurrencyGroupSizes/VB/currencygroupsizes.vb#1)]

"$"符號，符號"-"是，和`n`是數字。The symbol "$" is the , the symbol "-" is the , and `n` is a number. |值Value|相關聯的模式Associated pattern| |-----------|------------------------| |00|($n)($n)| |11|-$n-$n| |22|$ n$-n| |33|$n-$n-| |44|（n $）(n$)| |55|-n $-n$| |66|n $n-$| |77|n$-n$-| |88|-n $-n $| |99|-$ n-$ n| |1010|n $-n $-| |1111|$ n-$ n-| |1212|$ n$ -n| |1313|n-$n- $| |1414|($ n)($ n)| |1515|（n $）(n $)| ## Examples 下列範例顯示如何屬性會定義負值的貨幣值的格式。The following example shows how the property defines the format of negative currency values. 它會擷取所有的特定文化特性，主機電腦上所定義，並顯示每個文化特性屬性值、 其相關聯的模式和數字格式化為貨幣值。It retrieves all the specific cultures that are defined on the host computer and displays each culture's property value, its associated pattern, and a number formatted as a currency value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這這個屬性所傳回的物件不會變更，不論目前的文化特性。This object returned by this property does not change, regardless of the current culture. 它代表文化特性而異，也就是使用英文的語言，但不是能搭配任何國家/地區相關聯的文化特性的格式化的慣例。It represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, which is a culture associated with the English language but not with any country/region. 在格式化的作業與文化特性無關或，跨多個文化特性產生適用於顯示的結果字串中用於文化特性而異。The invariant culture is used in formatting operations that are culture-independent or that produce result strings suitable for display across multiple cultures. ## Examples 下列範例顯示的預設屬性值。The following example displays the default property values of the . summary.span: 取得或設定數值內小數點左邊數字的各個群組中的位數。

span.span: The number of digits in each group to the left of the decimal in numeric values.

value.span: 的預設值為一個只含有一個項目 (已設定為 3) 的一維陣列。

span.span: The default for is a one-dimensional array with only one element, which is set to 3.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值屬性會影響使用"N"來格式化的數字值的結果。The value of the property affects the result of number values that are formatted by using the "N" . 如果是自訂數值格式字串或其他標準數值格式會使用字串，值屬性會被忽略。If a custom numeric format string or other standard numeric format strings are used, the value of the property is ignored. 一維陣列中的每個項目必須是從 1 到 9 的整數。Every element in the one-dimensional array must be an integer from 1 through 9. 最後一個項目可以是 0。The last element can be 0. 陣列的第一個元素的左邊的數字的最小顯著性群組中定義的項目數。The first element of the array defines the number of elements in the least significant group of digits immediately to the left of the . 每個後續項目是指先前群組的左邊的數字的下一個重要群組。Each subsequent element refers to the next significant group of digits to the left of the previous group. 如果陣列的最後一個項目不是 0，其餘的數字會根據分組陣列的最後一個元素。If the last element of the array is not 0, the remaining digits are grouped based on the last element of the array. 如果最後一個項目為 0，會不會分組其餘數字。If the last element is 0, the remaining digits are not grouped. 例如，如果陣列包含 {3，4，5}，字分組的類似於 「 55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00"。For example, if the array contains { 3, 4, 5 }, the digits are grouped similar to "55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00". 如果陣列包含 {3，4，0}，數字都會群組類似於 「 55555555555555555,4444,333.00"。If the array contains { 3, 4, 0 }, the digits are grouped similar to "55555555555555555,4444,333.00". ## Examples 下列範例示範變更的影響屬性。The following example demonstrates the effect of changing the property. span.span: The default for is a one-dimensional array with only one element, which is set to 3.

remarks.format: ## Remarks "P"標準格式字串搭配使用屬性來定義出現的位數整數類資料群組中。The property is used with the "P" standard format string to define the number of digits that appear in integral groups. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md). 一維陣列中的每個項目必須是從 1 到 9 的整數。Every element in the one-dimensional array must be an integer from 1 through 9. 最後一個項目可以是 0。The last element can be 0. 陣列的第一個元素的左邊的數字的最小顯著性群組中定義的項目數。The first element of the array defines the number of elements in the least significant group of digits immediately to the left of the . 每個後續項目是指先前群組的左邊的數字的下一個重要群組。Each subsequent element refers to the next significant group of digits to the left of the previous group. 如果陣列的最後一個項目不是 0，其餘的數字會根據分組陣列的最後一個元素。If the last element of the array is not 0, the remaining digits are grouped based on the last element of the array. 如果最後一個項目為 0，會不會分組其餘數字。If the last element is 0, the remaining digits are not grouped. 例如，如果陣列包含 {3，4，5}，字分組的類似於 「 55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00%"。For example, if the array contains { 3, 4, 5 }, the digits are grouped similar to "55,55555,55555,55555,4444,333.00%". 如果陣列包含 {3，4，0}，將數字群組類似於 「 55555555555555555,4444,333.00%"。If the array contains { 3, 4, 0 }, the digits are grouped similar to "55555555555555555,4444,333.00%". ## Examples 下列範例示範變更的影響屬性。The following example demonstrates the effect of changing the property. [!code-cpp[PercentGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/PercentGroupSizes/CPP/percentgroupsizes.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[PercentGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/PercentGroupSizes/CS/percentgroupsizes.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PercentGroupSizes#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/PercentGroupSizes/VB/percentgroupsizes.vb#1)]

"%"符號，符號"-"是，和`n`是數字。The symbol "%" is the , the symbol "-" is the , and `n` is a number. 值 3 11 引進.NET Framework 2.0 中，而且不能用在更早版本。Values 3-11 were introduced in the .NET Framework 2.0 and cannot be used in earlier versions. |值Value|相關聯的模式Associated pattern| |-----------|------------------------| |00|-n %-n %| |11|-n%-n%| |22|-%n-%n| |33|%n%-n| |44|%n-%n-| |55|n-%n-%| |66|n%-n%-| |77|-% n-% n| |88|n %-n %-| |99|%n-% n-| |1010|%n% -n| |1111|n-%n- %|
